problem_text:
Equichordal Points of Convex Bodies

PROBLEM:
⋆Does there exist (for n ≥ 2) an n-dimensional convex body which has two equichordal points?

If the set C is star-shaped from its interior point p (i.e. C contains every segment joining p to another point of C), p is called an equichordal point of C provided all chords of C which pass through p are of the same length. (For example, the center of a spherical region is an equichordal point.)
